<h1 id="Relative-Probabilities">Relative Probabilities<a class="anchor-link" href="#Relative-Probabilities">&#182;</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># just a helper function for easier youtube call</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">strip_url</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">url</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;https://youtu.be/&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">YouTubeVideo</span>
<span class="n">url</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://youtu.be/kmqfftmc6hE&#39;</span>
<span class="n">YouTubeVideo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">strip_url</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Ans">Ans<a class="anchor-link" href="#Ans">&#182;</a></h3><p>$$
\textstyle
\begin{array}{l}
\dfrac {p(Exactly\ One\ Head)}{p(First\ flip\ is\ Only\ Head)}\\ \\
\text {Total No of flips } = 4 \\ \\
\text {Total No of outcomes} = 2^4 = 16 \\ \\
\end{array}
$$</p>
<p>It is tedious to write out all 16 outcomes or sketch a tree, so we could only focus on favourable outcomes (other outcomes only needed for total count)</p>

</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<table>

</tr>

</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$$
\textstyle
\therefore \dfrac { \dfrac {4}{16}}{ \dfrac {1}{16}} = 4
$$</p>

<p>$$
\dfrac { \dfrac {4}{16}}{ \dfrac {8}{16}} = \dfrac {4}{8} = 0.5
$$</p>

<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">url</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://youtu.be/YQhStz2eHYY&#39;</span>
<span class="n">YouTubeVideo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">strip_url</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">graphviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">helpers</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">draw_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span>

<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">draw_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="c1"># hardcoded for this problem now</span>

<span class="c1"># Root - Choosing between Fair or Lodged Coin</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#33EA4C:#A2E9FF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Fair Coin - Choosing between Person 1 (HHT) or Person 2 (THH)</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;F&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#33EA4C:#A2E9FF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Fair Coin - HHT - Person 1 - Me - M</span>
<span class="n">highlight_nodes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;H1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H3&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;T7&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#33EA4C&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Fair Coin - THH - Person 2 - You - Y</span>
<span class="n">highlight_nodes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;T1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H4&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H9&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#A2E9FF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Loaded Coin - Choosing between Person 1 (HHT) or Person 2 (THH)</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;L&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#33EA4C:#A2E9FF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Loaded Coin - HHT - Person 1 - Me - M</span>
<span class="n">highlight_nodes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;H2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H5&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;T11&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#33EA4C&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># Loaded Coin - THH - Person 2 - You - Y</span>
<span class="n">highlight_nodes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;T2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H6&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;H13&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">update_samecoin_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">highlight_nodes</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#A2E9FF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">g</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Green flow indicates Person 1 picking up a Coin (Fair or Loaded) and flipping it thrice<br>
Blue flow indicates Person 2 picking up a Coin (Fair or Loaded) and flipping it thrice</p>
<p>Person 1 always gets the order <strong>HHT</strong>  so HHT characterizes Person 1
Person 2 always gets the order <strong>THH</strong>  so THH characterizes Person 2</p>
<p>Let us denote Person 1 by <strong>M</strong> (Me), and Person 2 by <strong>Y</strong> (You)</p>
<p>Thus, $p(HHT)$ is same as  $p(M)$  and $p(THH)$ is same as $p(Y)$. With this understanding, (closely follow above diagram for below calculations)</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$$
\textstyle
\begin{array}{l}
p(\ F\ \cap\  H\ \cap\ H\ \cap\  T\ ) = p(\ F\ \cap\  HHT\ ) = p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ ) \\ \\
\text {Also} \\ \\
p(\ F\ \cap\  H\ \cap\ H\ \cap\  T\ ) = p(\ F\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ T\ ) = (0.5)^4 = 0.0625\\ \\
\therefore\   p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ ) = 0.0625 \\ \\
\text {Similarly} \\ \\
p(\ F\ \cap\  T\ \cap\ H\ \cap\  H\ ) = p(\ F\ )p(\ T\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ H\ ) = (0.5)^4 = 0.0625\\  \\
\therefore\   p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ ) = 0.0625 \\ \\
p(\ L\ \cap\  H\ \cap\ H\ \cap\  T\ ) = p(\ L\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ T\ ) = (0.5)(0.9)^2(0.1) = 0.0405\\ \\
\therefore\   p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ ) = 0.0405 \\ \\
p(\ L\ \cap\  T\ \cap\ H\ \cap\  H\ ) = p(\ L\ )p(\ T\ )p(\ H\ )p(\ H\ ) = (0.5)(0.1)(0.9)^2 = 0.0405\\  \\
\therefore\   p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ ) = 0.0405 \\ \\
\text {Summarizing..} \\ \\
p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ ) = 0.0625 \\
p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ ) = 0.0625 \\
p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ ) = 0.0405 \\
p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ ) = 0.0405 \\ \\
\end{array}
$$<br>
Applying Bayes Theorem, 
$$
\textstyle
\begin{array}{l}
p(\ F\ |\ M\ ) = \dfrac {p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ )}{\sum p(\ M\ )} = \dfrac {p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ )}{ p(\ F\ \cap\ M\ ) + p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ )} \\ \\
= \dfrac {0.0625}{0.0625 + 0.0405} = 0.6068 \\ \\
p(\ F\ |\ Y\ ) = \dfrac {p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ )}{\sum p(\ Y\ )} = \dfrac {p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ )}{ p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ ) + p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ )} \\ \\
= \dfrac {0.0625}{0.0625 + 0.0405} = 0.6068 \\ \\
p(\ L\ |\ M\ ) = \dfrac {p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ )}{\sum p(\ M\ )} = \dfrac {p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ )}{ p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ ) + p(\ L\ \cap\ M\ )} \\ \\
= \dfrac {0.0405}{0.0625 + 0.0405} = 0.3932 \\ \\
p(\ L\ |\ Y\ ) = \dfrac {p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ )}{\sum p(\ Y\ )} = \dfrac {p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ )}{ p(\ F\ \cap\ Y\ ) + p(\ L\ \cap\ Y\ )} \\ \\
= \dfrac {0.0405}{0.0625 + 0.0405} = 0.3932 \\ \\ \\
\text {Summarizing..} \\ \\
p(\ F\ |\ M\ ) = 0.6068 \\ 
p(\ F\ |\ Y\ ) = 0.6068 \\
p(\ L\ |\ M\ ) = 0.3932 \\
p(\ L\ |\ Y\ ) = 0.3932 \\
\end{array}
$$</p>

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Question:-What-is-the-probability-that-we-flipped-coins-of-the-same-type?">Question: What is the probability that we flipped coins of the same type?<a class="anchor-link" href="#Question:-What-is-the-probability-that-we-flipped-coins-of-the-same-type?">&#182;</a></h3><p>There are 2 possible cases of we both having same type of coin, and they are <strong>independent</strong> of each other.</p>
<ol>
<li>Both have fair coins and initiate our flip chain - case A</li>
<li>Both have loaded coins and initiate our flip chain - case B</li>
</ol>
<p>Since 2 cases, probability of either case happening is simply their sum (as they are independent as well)</p>
<p>$$
p(\ A\ \cup\ B\ ) = p(\ A\ ) + p(\ B\ )
$$</p>
<p>$p(\ A\ ) $:</p>
<p><strong>Both have fair coins</strong> and initiate our flip chain. That is,</p>
<ol>
<li>Given its me or HHT, coin being F, that is,  $p(\ F\ |\ M\ )$ - case A1 </li>
<li>Given its you or THH, coin being F, that is,  $p(\ F\ |\ Y\ )$ - case A2</li>
</ol>
<p>We need both to be same type, in the sense, <strong>both case A1 and A2 should happen</strong>. Thus</p>
<p>$$
p(\ A\ ) = p(\ A1\ \cap A2\ )
$$</p>
<p>A1 and A2 are also <strong>independent</strong> to each other. We do not have influence on each other. So,..</p>
<p>$$
p(\ A\ ) = p(\ A1\ \cap A2\ ) = p(\ A1\ )p(\ A2\ ) = p(\ F\ |\ M\ )p(\ F\ |\ Y\ ) = (0.6068)(0.6068) = 0.3682
$$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$p(\ B\ ) $:</p>
<p><strong>Both have loaded coins</strong> and initiate our flip chain. That is,</p>
<ol>
<li>Given its me or HHT, coin being L, that is,  $p(\ L\ |\ M\ )$ - case B1 </li>
<li>Given its you or THH, coin being L, that is,  $p(\ L\ |\ Y\ )$ - case B2</li>
</ol>
<p>We need both to be same type, in the sense, <strong>both case B1 and B2 should happen</strong>. Thus</p>
<p>$$
p(\ B\ ) = p(\ B1\ \cap B2\ )
$$</p>
<p>B1 and B2 are also <strong>independent</strong> to each other. We do not have influence on each other. So,..</p>
<p>$$
p(\ B\ ) = p(\ B1\ \cap B2\ ) = p(\ B1\ )p(\ B2\ ) = p(\ L\ |\ M\ )p(\ L\ |\ Y\ ) = (0.3932)(0.3932) = 0.1546
$$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><strong>Finally</strong></p>
<p>$$
p(\ A\ \cup\ B\ ) = p(\ A\ ) + p(\ B\ ) = 0.3682 + 0.1546 = 0.523  
$$</p>
<p><hr></p>
<div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">Thus, probability that we both picked same type of coin is 0.523 or 52.3%</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The next set of questions are complicated, so we will see in separate section next</p>

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Each flow from Root to end, is a possibility of a sequence. For eg, on left most of tree, we have a sequence HHH, 3 heads in all 3 flips. This terminology is important. Each sequence may have any number of heads or nothing at all. Let us check, what are all the possible sequences from 3 flips and no of heads in each of those sequences.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">combi_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">combi_df</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[3]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As you might have guessed, the no of sequence depends on no of flips n.</p>
<p>$$
\text {No of sequences} =  2^n , \text {where n is no of flips}
$$</p>
<p>Let us check, the statistics of how many heads occur in each sequence, and count them.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>So for 3 flips, we have a <strong>distribution</strong> of no of heads in sequences, and thus their associated probability as well. If we try to graph them, we get something like below.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">plot_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">final_df</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>

"
>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It is important to understand the above graph very well. For instance, on LHS, when X=1, it means, there are 3 sequences with 1 head, and we could calculate its probability as $\dfrac {3}{2^3}=0.375$ which is shown on RHS. Note the nature of the graph. Let us try again for 4 flips.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="4-Flips">4 Flips<a class="anchor-link" href="#4-Flips">&#182;</a></h3>

</div>

    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">4</span>

<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">draw_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">g</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now you see, where the graph goes as n increases? This is <strong>binomial distribution</strong>. Let us put aside formula and definition for a while and only focus on the nature of these graphs.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="What-happens-when-flips-increase?">What happens when flips increase?<a class="anchor-link" href="#What-happens-when-flips-increase?">&#182;</a></h3><p>Let us find out by a small animation</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.animation</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">animation</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">coinflipviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">autoformat</span>

<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;No of flips  :  </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">temp_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">temp_df</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>
<span class="n">ani</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">animation</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FuncAnimation</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animate</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">interval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>    
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">HTML</span>
<span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ani</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_html5_video</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ol>
<li>Note that as we increase the no of flips, the graphs above approximate to a Guassian like structure. </li>
<li>Maximum number of heads is always for half the number of flips. That is, if n = 10, then x = 5, that is sequence having 5 heads, has maximum probability. This is well observed, when n=even </li>
</ol>
<p>The above graphical depictions would be very helpful to answer the quizes as we would see below.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Pascal's-triangle">Pascal's triangle<a class="anchor-link" href="#Pascal's-triangle">&#182;</a></h3><p>The numbers on the LHS, the n(x), interestingly are the same as in Pascal's triangle, where the row corresponds to the no of flips.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="2018-07-20_17h11_37.png"></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>These numbers are called binomial coefficients. That is, the No of sequences we get on LHS, are binomial co efficients. Pascal's triangle is made up of binomial co oefficients.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">So for any number of flips x, one could of course look at the respective row in Pascal's triagle to get n(x) easily. </div></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Quiz-Answers">Quiz Answers<a class="anchor-link" href="#Quiz-Answers">&#182;</a></h2><h3 id="1.-The-Probability-of-every-Sequence-becomes-Small----True-or-False?">1. The Probability of every Sequence becomes Small  - True or False?<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.-The-Probability-of-every-Sequence-becomes-Small----True-or-False?">&#182;</a></h3><p>Let us take an example. Say, no of flips = 4, Then</p>
<p>$$
\text {Total No of sequences} = 2^4 = 16 \\ \\
\text {Probability of any single sequence} = \dfrac {\text {No of that sequence}}{\text {Total No of sequences}} = \dfrac {1}{16} = 0.0625
$$</p>
<p>Generalizing, for any no of flips <strong>n</strong>, 
$$
\text {Total No of sequences} = 2^n \\ \\
\text {Probability of any single sequence} = \dfrac {\text {No of that sequence}}{\text {Total No of sequences}} = \dfrac {1}{2^n}
$$</p>
<p>Obviously, as <strong>n</strong> increases, $\dfrac {1}{2^n}$ decreases.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">Thus, as <b>n</b> increases, the probability of every Sequence becomes small. So its True
</div></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="2.-The-probability-of-every-number-of-heads-becomes-small---True-or-False?">2. The probability of every number of heads becomes small - True or False?<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.-The-probability-of-every-number-of-heads-becomes-small---True-or-False?">&#182;</a></h3><p>Let no of flips = 4, 
Let us take specific number of heads, say, X = 2 (3 heads). Let us observe, what happens to X = 2, when n increases in below animation directly</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.animation</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">animation</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">coinflipviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">autoformat</span>

<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># highlight X = 2</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_color</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;r&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;No of flips  :  </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">     Red  : (X=2)&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">temp_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">temp_df</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>
<span class="n">ani</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">animation</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FuncAnimation</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animate</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">interval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<p>So even though, initially it increased from 0.25 (for n=2), to 0.375 (n=3), thereafter it reduces and approaches to zero as can be seen on above animation.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">Thus, as <b>n</b> increases, the probability of every number of heads become small. So its true
</div><br></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="3.-The-probability-of-every-proportion-of-heads-becomes-Small.-True-or-False?">3. The probability of every proportion of heads becomes Small. True or False?<a class="anchor-link" href="#3.-The-probability-of-every-proportion-of-heads-becomes-Small.-True-or-False?">&#182;</a></h3><p>Let n = 4,</p>
<h4 id="Let-X-=-50%-of-n.">Let X = 50% of n.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Let-X-=-50%-of-n.">&#182;</a></h4><p>Now this does not make sense for odd no of <strong>n</strong>, because then X would be non integer. For eg, if I have 5 flips, then X cannot be 2.5 heads! So we will check for only even no of flips.</p>
<h4 id="Note:">Note:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Note:">&#182;</a></h4><p>Graph's y axis limits are maintained at constant, just to illustrate the reducing nature of probabilities. This had been the case all along, only that earlier, the y axis was auto scaling so reducing nature was only obvious from carefully observing numbers.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.animation</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">animation</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">coinflipviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">autoformat</span>

<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>        
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># highlight X corresponding to 50% of no of flips</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>  <span class="c1"># if only even, </span>
        <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span>    
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="c1">#print(y)</span>
            <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_color</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;r&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>    
                        
    <span class="c1"># also set y limit to keep the scale constant to view the effect as n increases</span>
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># increase space to insert bar value and assuming we will not cross 0.5 prob ever</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>     
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">260</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># just hardcoding for this example. MODIFY THIS IF YOU CHANGE N_FLIPS</span>
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>         
    
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;No of flips  :  </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">    Red X = 50</span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f No of flips&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">temp_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">temp_df</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>
<span class="n">ani</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">animation</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FuncAnimation</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animate</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">interval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>    
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">HTML</span>
<span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ani</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_html5_video</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From RHS graph, one could easily observe that the maximum probability that could occur (at $X = \dfrac {n}{2}$) for any <strong>n</strong> decreases, as <strong>n</strong> increases.</p>
<p>Since the max probability is reducing, it is also obvious, for any other X it would still reduce, which can also be observed from other adjacent blue bars from above RHS graph.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">Thus, as <b>n</b> increases, <b>X = any % of n</b> decreases. So this is also True. 
</div><br></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="4.-The-probability-of-every-range-of-proportions-becomes-small---True-or-False?">4. The probability of every range of proportions becomes small - True or False?<a class="anchor-link" href="#4.-The-probability-of-every-range-of-proportions-becomes-small---True-or-False?">&#182;</a></h3><p>We will prove this by taking the exceptional case, where it is False. This is difficult to observe at first, as there are wide range of proportions possible, but once we understand the nature of the "Gaussian" like curve of probabilities, it would be easier to comprehend.</p>
<p>Note the phrase <strong>range of proportions</strong>. This means, from any % of n to any other % of n. The exceptional case we take up to argue its falseness is,</p>
<h4 id="$X-\leq-50\%$-of-n">$X \leq 50\%$ of n<a class="anchor-link" href="#$X-\leq-50\%$-of-n">&#182;</a></h4><p>Suppose, n = 5, then $X \leq \dfrac {5}{2} = X \leq 2.5$, thus X = 0, 1, 2</p>
<p>We should then find</p>
<p>$$
p(X \leq 2.5) = p(X = 0) + p(X = 1) + p(X = 2)
$$</p>
<p>Note also that, for n = even, we cannot accurately divide 50%, as a fair share of probability goes to middle X=50% case (just like we saw earlier), so for this case, we will take only X = odd to prove our point.</p>
<p>This partiality does not matter, as n tends to go infinity, we get a smooth guassian like density function, and we just take area for range of X, instead of individual bars as of now.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.animation</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">animation</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">coinflipviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">autoformat</span>

<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>        
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># highlight X corresponding to 50% of no of flips</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>  
        <span class="k">pass</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="c1"># if only odd</span>
        <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">math</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">floor</span>
        <span class="n">i_50_range</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span> 
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_bar</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">i_50_range</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_bar</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_color</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;r&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>  
            <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.52</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;  Red Area: 0.5&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
                        
    <span class="c1"># also set y limit to keep the scale constant to view the effect as n increases</span>
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># increase space to insert bar value and assuming we will not cross 0.5 prob ever</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>     
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">260</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># just hardcoding for this example. MODIFY THIS IF YOU CHANGE N_FLIPS</span>
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>         
    
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;No of flips  :  </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">    Red X &lt;= 50</span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f No of flips&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">temp_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">temp_df</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">10</span>
<span class="n">ani</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">animation</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FuncAnimation</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animate</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">interval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>    
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">HTML</span>
<span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ani</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_html5_video</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From RHS graph, pause for every odd no of flips, and try calculating sum of red bar values. It would always be 0.5.</p>
<p>$
n = 1,\  X \leq (1)(0.5),\  p(X \leq 0)\  = \ p(X = 0) \ = \ 0.5 \\ \\
n = 3,\  X \leq (3)(0.5), \  p(X \leq 1)\  = \ p(X = 0) \ + p(X = 1)\ = \ 0.125 + 0.375 = 0.5 \\ \\
n = 5,\  X \leq (5)(0.5), \  p(X \leq 2)\  = \ p(X = 0) \ + p(X = 1)\ + p(X=2)\ = \ 0.03125+0.15625+0.31250 = 0.5 \\ \\
n = 7,\  X \leq (7)(0.5), \  p(X \leq 3)\  = \ p(X = 0) \ + p(X = 1)\ + p(X=2)\ + p(X=3)\ = \ 0.00781+0.05468+0.16406+0.2734375 = 0.5 \\ \\
n = 9,\  X \leq (9)(0.5), \  p(X \leq 4)\  = \ p(X = 0) \ + p(X = 1)\ + p(X=2)\ + p(X=3)\ + p(X=4)\ = \ 0.001953+0.017578125+0.0703125+0.1640625+0.24609375= 0.5 \\ \\
$</p>
<p>This is a typical charactersitic of such a distribution. This could be extended that, as n approaches $\infty$, the smooth probability curve we get, always have half of its area to be of 0.5 probability. This makes sense, after all, total probability (total area of the curve) should be 1, and it is symmetrical (as you can see how it is growing), so one could easily infer, half of it would be having 50% probability.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">Thus, since the total probability remains constant at 0.5 for X $\leq$ 50% of n, <b>not every range of proportions</b> has probability reduces as n increases. So this statement is <b>False</b> </div><br></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="5.-The-probability-of-some-ranges-of-proportions-becomes-small---True-or-False?">5. The probability of some ranges of proportions becomes small - True or False?<a class="anchor-link" href="#5.-The-probability-of-some-ranges-of-proportions-becomes-small---True-or-False?">&#182;</a></h3><p>What if our range of proportions is itself, less than or more than 50%?  Let us find out for 33% (to be inline with <a href="https://gist.github.com/parthi2929/2b0fc593cd8bccf99a6c4ae1ccb60005">goldsong</a>'s explanation.</p>
<h4 id="$X-\leq-33\%$-of-n">$X \leq 33\%$ of n<a class="anchor-link" href="#$X-\leq-33\%$-of-n">&#182;</a></h4><p>Earlier we chose odd X, because, we were able to find X the sum of which wholly satisfied our &lt; 50% criteria. In this case, it is tricky. It would be evident, when we plot 33% of n values in a table.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>

<span class="n">cols</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n_flips&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;n_33_range&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;floored_x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ceiled_x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">cols</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">yellow</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">val</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;yellow&#39;</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s1">&#39;background-color: </span><span class="si">%s</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="n">color</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">):</span>  <span class="c1"># 10 flips</span>
    <span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">i</span>
    <span class="n">n_33_range</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">i</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">0.33</span>
    <span class="n">floored_x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">0.33</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">math</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">ceil</span>
    <span class="n">ceiled_x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ceil</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">0.33</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;n_flips&#39;</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;n_33_range&#39;</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">n_33_range</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;floored_x&#39;</span> <span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">floored_x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;ceiled_x&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">ceiled_x</span><span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
<span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n_flips&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;floored_x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;ceiled_x&#39;</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n_flips&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;floored_x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;ceiled_x&#39;</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">object</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">T</span>  <span class="c1"># ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47907195/pandas-transpose-resets-decimal-rounding</span>

<span class="c1">#list(df.columns.values)</span>
<span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">applymap</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">yellow</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">subset</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">IndexSlice</span><span class="p">[:,[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">]])</span>
</pre></div>
