<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Observe that, when no of flips = 3, 6, 9, etc, as highlighted, we have 33% of n as a whole number (to observe equivalent no of heads).</p>
<p>For example,</p>
<p>When n_flips = 3, n_33_range = 0.99 $\cong$ 1, so X = 1 could almost wholly represent 33% of n_flips<br>
When n_flips = 6, n_33_range = 1.98 $\cong$ 2, so X = 2 could almost wholly represent 33% of n_flips<br>
When n_flips = 9, n_33_range = 2.97 $\cong$ 3, so X = 3 could almost wholly represent 33% of n_flips</p>
<p>However, for other values of n_flips, picking up floor or ceiled value would leave gaps introducing undesired errors that could screw up our observation.</p>
<p>For example,</p>
<p>When n_flips = 2, n_33_range = 0.66, so neither X = 0 or X = 1 is good approximation to be taken for observation.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">
Thus, in this case, we will calculate total area of 33% of n_flips, only when n_flips is at multiples of 3.  If we have 10 flips, we could thus calculate at 3rd flip, 6th flip, 9th flip and observe if total area at those flips increase or decrease.</div></p>
<p>Also note, ceiled value of n_33_range, serves better than floored value unlike earlier cases.</p>
<p>Visualizing for 33%.. (n_flips increased to 12, to have one more multiple of 3 datapoint)</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.animation</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">animation</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">coinflipviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">autoformat</span>

<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">close</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>        
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="c1"># highlight X corresponding to 50% of no of flips</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span>  <span class="c1"># only if multiple of 3 as reasoned earlier</span>

        <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">math</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">ceil</span>
        <span class="n">i_33_range</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ceil</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">0.33</span><span class="p">))</span>  <span class="c1"># ceiled value serves better in our case</span>
        <span class="n">red_area</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_bar</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">i_33_range</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
            <span class="n">rect</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_bar</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_color</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;r&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>  
            <span class="n">red_area</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_height</span><span class="p">()</span>
            
        <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.52</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;  Red Area : </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">red_area</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">)</span>
                        
    <span class="c1"># also set y limit to keep the scale constant to view the effect as n increases</span>
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># increase space to insert bar value and assuming we will not cross 0.5 prob ever</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>     
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">950</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># just hardcoding for this example. MODIFY THIS IF YOU CHANGE N_FLIPS</span>
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>         
    
    
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">animate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">clear</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">suptitle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;No of flips  :  </span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">    Red X &lt;= 33</span><span class="si">% o</span><span class="s1">f No of flips&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">14</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">temp_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">animate_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">temp_df</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="n">n_flips</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">12</span>
<span class="n">ani</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">animation</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">FuncAnimation</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">animate</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">arange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">interval</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1000</span><span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Thus, you could observe from graph that,</p>
<p>$
\small {
n = 3,\  X \leq (3)(0.33),\  p(X \leq 0.99)\  \cong p(X \leq 1)\ = p(X=0) + p(X=1) = 0.125+0.375 = 0.5  \\ \\  
n = 6,\  X \leq (6)(0.33), \  p(X \leq 1.98)\ \cong p(X \leq 2)\ = p(X=0) + p(X=1) + p(X=2) =  0.01562+0.09375+0.234375 = 0.344 \\ \\  
n = 9,\  X \leq (9)(0.33), \  p(X \leq 2.97)\  \cong p(X \leq 3)\ =  p(X=0) + p(X=1) + p(X=2) +p(X=3) = \\ \\
0.001953125 + 0.017578125 + 0.0703125 + 0.1640625 = 0.2539 \\ \\  
n = 12,\  X \leq (12)(0.33), \  p(X \leq 3.96)\  \cong p(X \leq 4)\ = p(X=0) + p(X=1) + p(X=2) +p(X=3) + p(X=4) = \\ \\ 
\dfrac {1}{2^{12}} + \dfrac {12}{2^{12}} + \dfrac {66}{2^{12}} + \dfrac {220}{2^{12}} + \dfrac {495}{2^{12}} = 0.00024414062 + 0.0029296875 + 0.01611328125 + 0.053710937 + 0.12084960937 = 0.19384765574
}
$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Thus, as you could see, for X $\leq$ 33% of n, the probability decreases as n increases.</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">So, yes, for some ranges, the probabilities decrease as <b>n</b> increases. So it is <b>True</b>. 
</div><br></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Note:">Note:<a class="anchor-link" href="#Note:">&#182;</a></h3><p>Take care trying more number of flips with above snippets. They are not efficient, and thus time sensitive. The nature of our problem is, the numbers grow exponentially, so the PC might have for long time, even for n greater than 15.</p>

## Problem Set 3 - Many Flips Ctd

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># just a helper function for easier youtube call</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>These are thankfully pretty straight forward, so we could directly calculate using Bayes' theorem.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="4-Heads-and-0-Tails">4 Heads and 0 Tails<a class="anchor-link" href="#4-Heads-and-0-Tails">&#182;</a></h3><p>This means, 4 flips, and sequence HHHH</p>
<p>So question is what is the probability of fair coin, given HHHH?</p>
<p>$
p(Fair\ |\ Flips) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ Flips)}{\sum p(Flips\ )} \\ \\
p(Fair\ |\ HHHH) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ HHHH)}{\sum p(HHHH\ )} 
= \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ HHHH)}{p(Fair\ \cap\ HHHH) + p(Loaded\ \cap\ HHHH)} 
= \dfrac {(0.9)(0.5)^4}{(0.9)(0.5)^4 + (0.1)(0.9)^4} = 0.4615
$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">p_F</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.9</span>
<span class="n">p_HF</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span>

<span class="n">p_L</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.1</span>
<span class="n">p_HL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.9</span>

<span class="c1"># 4 flips, 4 Heads and 0 Tails</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_4</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">4</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">p_L</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HL</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_4</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[12]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.4615952732644018</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="10-Heads-and-0-Tails">10 Heads and 0 Tails<a class="anchor-link" href="#10-Heads-and-0-Tails">&#182;</a></h3><p>Similar like above, this time to the power of 10</p>
<p>$
p(Fair\ |\ Flips) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ Flips)}{\sum p(Flips\ )} \\ \\
p(Fair\ |\ 10H) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 10H)}{\sum p(10H\ )} 
= \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 10H)}{p(Fair\ \cap\ 10H) + p(Loaded\ \cap\ 10H)} 
= \dfrac {(0.9)(0.5)^{10}}{(0.9)(0.5)^{10} + (0.1)(0.9)^{10}} = 0.02458
$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># 10 flips, 10 Heads and 0 Tails</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_10</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">10</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">p_L</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HL</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_10</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[13]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.024587025215085937</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="20-Heads-and-0-Tails">20 Heads and 0 Tails<a class="anchor-link" href="#20-Heads-and-0-Tails">&#182;</a></h3><p>Similar like above, this time to the power of 20</p>
<p>$
p(Fair\ |\ Flips) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ Flips)}{\sum p(Flips\ )} \\ \\
p(Fair\ |\ 20H) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 20H)}{\sum p(20H\ )} 
= \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 20H)}{p(Fair\ \cap\ 20H) + p(Loaded\ \cap\ 20H)} 
= \dfrac {(0.9)(0.5)^{20}}{(0.9)(0.5)^{20} + (0.1)(0.9)^{20}} = 0.0007059
$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># 20 flips, 20 Heads and 0 Tails</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_20</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HF</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">20</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">p_L</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_HL</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_H_20</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[14]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>7.059301781108519e-05</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="0-Heads-and-5-Tails">0 Heads and 5 Tails<a class="anchor-link" href="#0-Heads-and-5-Tails">&#182;</a></h3><p>Similar like above, except that its tails now.</p>
<p>Implied No of flips = 5</p>
<p>$
p(Fair\ |\ Flips) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ Flips)}{\sum p(Flips\ )} \\ \\
p(Fair\ |\ 5T) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 5T)}{\sum p(5T\ )} 
= \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 5T)}{p(Fair\ \cap\ 5T) + p(Loaded\ \cap\ 5T)} 
= \dfrac {(0.9)(0.5)^{5}}{(0.9)(0.5)^{5} + (0.1)(0.1)^{5}} = 0.9999 \cong 1
$</p>
<p>Wow that is almost always probable. If you have 5 flips, fair coin having 5 T is almost certain??  Some one please double check this.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># 5 flips, 0 Heads and 5 Tails</span>
<span class="n">p_TF</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.5</span>

<span class="n">p_TL</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.1</span>

<span class="n">p_F_given_T_5</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_TF</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">p_F</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_TF</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span>  <span class="n">p_L</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">p_TL</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">p_F_given_T_5</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[15]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.999964445708597</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="5-Flips,-2-Heads,-3-Tails">5 Flips, 2 Heads, 3 Tails<a class="anchor-link" href="#5-Flips,-2-Heads,-3-Tails">&#182;</a></h3><p>n = 5, X = 2 (heads), We could use Pascal's triangle, to find the no of sequences having 2 heads for 5 flip problem.</p>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="image.png"></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From Pascal's triangle, there are 10 sequences possible where, there are 2 Heads and 3 Tails.</p>
<p>For fair coin, each of those 10 sequences will have joint probability, $p(2H3T) = (0.5)^2(0.5)^3 = 0.5^5 = 0.03125 $</p>
<p>For loaded coin, each of those 10 sequences will have joint probability $p(2H3T) = (0.9)^2(0.1)^3 = 0.00081 $</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Joint probability of coin being fair <strong>and</strong> having 2H3T for one sequence $ (0.9)(0.03125) = 0.028125 $<br>
<br></p>
<div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">There are 10 such joint probabilities for fair coin path out of $2^5 = 32$ fair coin path outcomes</div><p>Joint probability of coin being loaded <strong>and</strong> having 2H3T for one sequence $ (0.1)(0.00081) = 0.000081 $<br>
<br></p>
<div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">There are 10 such joint probabilities for loaded coin path out of $2^5 = 32$ loaded coin path outcomes</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>$
p(Fair\ |\ Flips) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ Flips)}{\sum p(Flips\ )} \\ \\
p(Fair\ |\ 2H3T) = \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 2H3T)}{\sum p(2H3T\ )} 
= \dfrac {p(Fair\ \cap\ 2H3T)}{p(Fair\ \cap\ 2H3T) + p(Loaded\ \cap\ 2H3T)} 
= \dfrac { 10(0.028125) }{ 10(0.028125) + 10(0.000081)} = 0.9971 \cong 1
$</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="mf">0.028125</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mf">0.028125</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mf">0.000081</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[16]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>0.9971282705807275</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Thus, answer is (probabilities which are &lt; 0.5)</p>
<p><br><div style="background-color:'#E3F2FD;  padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px;">
4 H 0 T<br>
10 H 0 T<br>
20 H 0 T<br>
</div><br></p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

## Problem Set 4 - Visualizing Many Flips

  <div tabindex="-1" id="notebook" class="border-box-sizing">
    <div class="container" id="notebook-container">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Visualizing-Many-Flips">Visualizing Many Flips<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visualizing-Many-Flips">&#182;</a></h1><h3 id="Comprehending-Many-Flips-Problem">Comprehending Many Flips Problem<a class="anchor-link" href="#Comprehending-Many-Flips-Problem">&#182;</a></h3><p><code>Problem Set 2 Probability</code> section is a huge speed bump in <a href="https://in.udacity.com/course/intro-to-statistics--st101">Intro to Statistics - Udacity course</a>, providing quizzes of high levels, which could be answered only with deeper knowledge of maths and also probability theory which is in strong contrast with flow of the course (which is irony because typical reader is new to it, that is why he is into the course in first place).</p>
<p>I have created below snippets to ease the pain. It provides functions to visualize and comprehend probability as no of flips increases. Hopefully it is useful to you.</p>
<p>Basic python is a pre requisite to understand the functions, but usage is simple and straight forward.</p>
<h3 id="Visualize-Probability-Tree">Visualize Probability Tree<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visualize-Probability-Tree">&#182;</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">graphviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span>

<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">draw_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given no of flips, this function creates a corresponding probability tree</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="c1">#g.attr(rankdir=&#39;LR&#39;, ranksep=&#39;0.5&#39;)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">attr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;node&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">shape</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;circle&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;10&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">attr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;edge&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;10&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">node</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;R&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;filled&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fillcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#DCDCDC&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>    <span class="c1"># first node</span>
    
    <span class="n">i_outcome</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">parent_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_flip</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">n_outcomes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="n">each_flip</span>
        
        <span class="n">temp_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
        <span class="n">p_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="c1"># parent index for each node</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_outcome</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_outcomes</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)):</span>  
            
            <span class="c1"># draw nodes, record parents</span>
            <span class="n">new_H</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;H</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_outcome</span><span class="p">)</span> 
            <span class="n">new_T</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;T</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_outcome</span><span class="p">)</span>             
            <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">node</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_H</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;H&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;filled&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fillcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#FFFAAE&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">node</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_T</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;T&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;filled&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fillcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#D2FFFF&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>                     
            <span class="n">i_outcome</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
            <span class="n">parents</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
            <span class="n">parent</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">parents</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">p_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parents</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
            
            <span class="c1"># debug</span>
            <span class="c1">#print(&#39;Flip:{} New H:{} New T:{} Parents:{} Parent Index:{}&#39;.format(each_flip, new_H, new_T,list(parents), p_index))</span>
            <span class="c1">#print(&#39;Flip:{} New H:{} New T:{} Parent:{}&#39;.format(each_flip, new_H, new_T,parent))</span>
            
            <span class="c1"># draw edges</span>
            <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">parent</span> <span class="ow">is</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">:</span>
                <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parent</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_H</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parent</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_T</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span> 
                <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_H</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_T</span><span class="p">)</span>
                
            
            <span class="c1"># for next set of H and T</span>
            <span class="n">p_index</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
            <span class="n">temp_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_H</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">temp_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_T</span><span class="p">)</span>
            
            
            
        <span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">temp_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">g</span>
        
<span class="n">draw_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Final-Outcomes-for-any-number-of-flips">Final Outcomes for any number of flips<a class="anchor-link" href="#Final-Outcomes-for-any-number-of-flips">&#182;</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span> 

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_combinations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the no of flips, this function will provide the final sequence combinations as a panda dataframe</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="c1"># setup data frame with necessary cols</span>
    <span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;sequence&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># get the combinations</span>
    <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">itertools</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">product</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">product</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">&#39;H&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;T&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">repeat</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">):</span>     
        <span class="n">combi</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">n_H</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">combi</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">count</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;H&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># no of heads</span>
        <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;sequence&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">combi</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">n_H</span> <span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="c1"># get no of heads in the combinations</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Given no of flips:&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">x = no of heads in respective sequence&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">df</span>
    
<span class="n">combi_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">combi_df</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

x = no of heads in respective sequence

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Characteristics-of-Probability-of-Sequences">Characteristics of Probability of Sequences<a class="anchor-link" href="#Characteristics-of-Probability-of-Sequences">&#182;</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the raw dataframe of combinations, this will provide n(x) and p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="c1"># setup data frame with necessary cols</span>
    <span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># get raw data</span>
    <span class="n">combi_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">x_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">combi_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># extract frequency</span>
    <span class="c1">#ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2161752/how-to-count-the-frequency-of-the-elements-in-a-list/2162045</span>
    <span class="n">x_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">itertools</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">groupby</span> 
    <span class="n">freq_tuple</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">group</span><span class="p">)))</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">key</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">group</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x_list</span><span class="p">)]</span>
    <span class="c1">#print(freq_tuple)</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_freq_tuple</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">freq_tuple</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">each_freq_tuple</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">n_x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">each_freq_tuple</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">p_x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_x</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="p">)</span>  <span class="c1"># its a conditional probability, thats y divided by total outcomes</span>
        <span class="n">df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">n_x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">p_x</span> <span class="p">},</span> <span class="n">ignore_index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="c1"># convert cols to integer (except p(x))</span>
    <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">astype</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1">#ref: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21291259/convert-floats-to-ints-in-pandas/21291622</span>

    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x) = total no of possible x type sequences&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;for eg, if x = 2, n(x) = 3, then there are 3 possible sequence types, in each of which, no of heads is 2&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>    
    
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">p(x) = conditional probability that n(x) could occur out of all outcomes&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">df</span>

<span class="n">final_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">final_df</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Given no of flips: 3

x = no of heads in respective sequence
n(x) = total no of possible x type sequences
for eg, if x = 2, n(x) = 3, then there are 3 possible sequence types, in each of which, no of heads is 2

p(x) = conditional probability that n(x) could occur out of all outcomes
</pre>

<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Few tweaks for better graph</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xlabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">label</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_xticklabels</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_yticklabels</span><span class="p">()):</span>
        <span class="n">label</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_fontsize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># Size here overrides font_prop</span>
        
    <span class="n">ymin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">ymax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_ylim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mf">1.1</span>  <span class="c1"># increase space to insert bar value</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylim</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">ymin</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">ymax</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># x values should be integers as its no of heads</span>
    <span class="n">xmin</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">xmax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_xlim</span><span class="p">()[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">math</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">ceil</span>
    <span class="n">xmaxint</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ceil</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xmax</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">xint</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xmin</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xmaxint</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticks</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">xint</span><span class="p">)</span>    


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Attach a text label above each bar displaying its height</span>
<span class="sd">    ref: https://matplotlib.org/2.0.2/examples/api/barchart_demo.html</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">rect</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">height</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_height</span><span class="p">()</span>
        <span class="c1">#text = &#39;%.4f&#39; % height</span>
        <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;{0: &lt;</span><span class="si">{width}</span><span class="s1">}&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">height</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span> 
        <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_x</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">rect</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_width</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mf">2.</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mf">1.005</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">height</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">text</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ha</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;center&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">va</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;bottom&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;red&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">plot_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given the dataframe with x, n(x), p(x) this provides two plots:</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs n(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    x vs p(x)</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">12</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">))</span>
    
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;x&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">N</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;n(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">P</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;p(x)&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tolist</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax1</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">N</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">xlabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Heads&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;No of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    

    <span class="n">rects</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ax2</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bar</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">P</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">autolabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rects</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">ylabel</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Probability of ANY of Sequences</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">having those no of Heads&#39;</span>   
    <span class="n">autoformat</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ax2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">xlabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ylabel</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tight_layout</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots_adjust</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">wspace</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.45</span><span class="p">)</span>    
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
    
<span class="n">plot_combinations_consolidated</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">final_df</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

## Problem Set 5 - Visualizing Many Flips - Ctd

  <div tabindex="-1" id="notebook" class="border-box-sizing">
    <div class="container" id="notebook-container">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Visualizing-Many-Flips---Ctd">Visualizing Many Flips - Ctd<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visualizing-Many-Flips---Ctd">&#182;</a></h1><h3 id="Objective">Objective<a class="anchor-link" href="#Objective">&#182;</a></h3><p>We have already seen coin flips, and how they relate to Pascal's triangle, how they evolve in to binomial distribution earlier in <code>Problem Set 2 - Probability</code> section.</p>
<p>In <code>19A. Central Limit Theorem</code> section, Sebastian ups the game with tossing a die with 3 outcomes (1,2,3). While we could follow pattern to calculate results, visualizing how that outcomes would be could be helpful to strengthen our insights.  So I have created another set of functions that could help us do that.</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong>: This section focuses only on programming part that helps us visualize the outputs when number of outcomes vary. I will have another section dedicated to <code>19A. Central Limit Theorem</code> where I pull up these functions and illustrate the examples provided by Sebastian.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># just a helper function for easier youtube call</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">strip_url</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">url</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;https://youtu.be/&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">YouTubeVideo</span>
<span class="n">url</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;https://youtu.be/jajxhNBnbmI&#39;</span>
<span class="n">YouTubeVideo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">strip_url</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[1]:</div>



<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea output_execute_result">

        <iframe
            width="400"
            height="300"
            src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jajxhNBnbmI"
            frameborder="0"
            allowfullscreen
        ></iframe>
        
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Toss-Definition">Toss Definition<a class="anchor-link" href="#Toss-Definition">&#182;</a></h3><p>Suppose we have a dice, that produces 3 outcomes 0, 1, 2 when tossed. Suppose we toss it 2 times. The questions at hand are,</p>
<ol>
<li>What are the possible outcomes/sequences</li>
<li>What are the number of occurences of sum of their individual outcomes? </li>
<li>What are their probabilities (assuming equal probability for n outcomes as $\dfrac {1}{n}$)</li>
</ol>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h4 id="What-are-the-possible-outcomes/sequences?">What are the possible outcomes/sequences?<a class="anchor-link" href="#What-are-the-possible-outcomes/sequences?">&#182;</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">graphviz</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">colorsys</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">random</span>


<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">HSVToHex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">h</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">b</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">colorsys</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">hsv_to_rgb</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">h</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">s</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">hexy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">%02X</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">r</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">255</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">%02X</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">255</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="s2">&quot;&quot;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="si">%02X</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span> <span class="o">%</span> <span class="nb">round</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">b</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">255</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">hexy</span>
 
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">getDistinctColors</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">huePartition</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">1.0</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">saturation</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.2</span>
    <span class="n">lightness</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.9</span>
    <span class="n">colors_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">HSVToHex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">huePartition</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">saturation</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lightness</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">value</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span><span class="p">)]</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">colors_list</span><span class="c1">#, colors_comp_list</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">draw_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_outcomes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Given no of flips, this function creates a corresponding probability tree</span>
<span class="sd">    For now, assuming outcomes are numbered</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="c1">#g.attr(rankdir=&#39;LR&#39;, ranksep=&#39;0.5&#39;)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">attr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;node&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">shape</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;circle&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;10&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">attr</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;edge&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fontsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;10&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">node</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">&#39;R&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;filled&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fillcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#DCDCDC&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>    <span class="c1"># first node</span>
    
    <span class="n">i_kids</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">parent_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># colors for each outcome</span>
    <span class="n">colors_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">getDistinctColors</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_outcomes</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="c1">#print(colors_list)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># for each flip</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_flip</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">per_flip_outcomes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_outcomes</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">each_flip</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
        <span class="c1"># for each node outcome of flip</span>
        <span class="n">temp_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
        <span class="n">p_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="c1"># parent index for each node</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_outcome</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">per_flip_outcomes</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">n_outcomes</span><span class="p">)):</span>
            
            
            <span class="c1"># draw nodes, record parents</span>
            <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_kid</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_outcomes</span><span class="p">):</span>                
                
                <span class="n">new_kid_ID</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">i_kids</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># Id the kid</span>
                <span class="n">new_kid_label</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">each_kid</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">node</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_kid_ID</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_kid_label</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">style</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;filled&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">fillcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;#</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">&#39;</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">colors_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_kid</span><span class="p">]),</span> <span class="n">fontcolor</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">&#39;black&#39;</span><span class="p">)</span>
                               
                <span class="n">parents</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
                <span class="n">parent</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">parents</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">p_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parents</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">0</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
                
                <span class="c1">#debug</span>
                <span class="c1">#print(&#39;Flip:{} Outcome:{} Kid\&#39;s Label:{} Possible ID:{} Parent:{}&#39;.format(each_flip, each_outcome, each_kid, i_kids, parent))    </span>
                
                <span class="n">i_kids</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
                
                <span class="c1"># draw edges</span>
                <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">parent</span> <span class="ow">is</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">:</span>
                    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">parent</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_kid_ID</span><span class="p">)</span>
                <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span> 
                    <span class="n">g</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">edge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;Root&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">new_kid_ID</span><span class="p">)</span>
                
                <span class="c1"># for next set of kids                    </span>
                <span class="n">temp_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">new_kid_ID</span><span class="p">)</span>
                
            <span class="n">p_index</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>

        <span class="n">parent_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">temp_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">()</span>
                
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">g</span>


<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Digraph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">strict</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">g</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">draw_graph</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">g</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_outcomes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n_flips</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">g</span>
</pre></div>
